net.sourceforge.nite.datainspection.impl

Class DiceMetricsForStringTwoSetValues

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.nite.datainspection.impl.DiceMetricsForStringTwoSetValues
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DistanceMetric

    public class DiceMetricsForStringTwoSetValues
extends java.lang.Object
implements DistanceMetric
    class DiceMetricsForStringTwoSetValues for distance metrics for alpha distance(v1,v2) = 1.0 if (v1.datype != v2.datype) distance(v1,v2) = lambda * distance(v1.aset,v2.aset) + (1-lambda)*distance(v1.bset,v2.bset) user can set the lambda value but it should be in [0,1]

      double distance(Value f, Value s)
      Implements distance of interface DistanceMetric distance(v1,v2) = 1.0 if (v1.datype != v2.datype) distance(v1,v2) = lambda * distance(v1.aset,v2.aset) + (1-lambda)*distance(v1.bset,v2.bset) User can set the lambda value but it should be in [0,1] using Dice coefficient on two given sets

    • Method Detail

      • setLambda

        public void setLambda(double lambda)
        Parameters:
        lambda - weighting factor for the distances between the a-sets and the b-sets part of the StringTwoSets values used in computing the distance between two of these type of Values

      • lambda

        public double lambda()

      • distance

        public double distance(Value f,
              Value s)
        Implements distance of interface DistanceMetric distance(v1,v2) = 1.0 if (v1.datype != v2.datype) distance(v1,v2) = lambda * distance(v1.aset,v2.aset) + (1-lambda)*distance(v1.bset,v2.bset) User can set the lambda value but it should be in [0,1] using Dice coefficient on two given sets
        Specified by:
        distance in interface DistanceMetric
        Parameters:
        f - and s must be StringTwoSetValues
        Returns:
        distance(f,s) as defined above
